text:
PHRASAL VERBS

Phrasal verbs are an important part of learning English language, and most times UNN tests students understanding of it. Most phrasal verbs consist of two words (verb + adverb or Verb + preposition) but a few consist of three words. They are translated literally, so you need to master them. Unlike idioms, they always go together.

List of Phrasal Verbs and their meaning (A – B)

1. Add in – include

2. Add to – increase

3. Add up – total

4. Ask for – request

5. Back away – retreat

6. Back out - withdraw

7. Back up – support

8. Bargain for – expect 

9. Barge in – interrupt 

10. Be after – want

11. Be along – appear/arrive

12. Be at – nag

13. Be back – return 

14. Be off – to leave

15. Bear out – confirm 

16. Black out – faint

17. Blot out – kill/destroy

18. Blow up – explode

19. Book up – reserve

20. Bow down – submit 

21. Branch off – diverge 

22. Break out – escape 

23. Beat down - strike with great force

24. Break up – stop/disintegrate

25. Beat off – repulse

26. Breathe in – inhale

27. Breathe out – exhale 

28. Bring forward – advance 

29. Bring in – introduce 

30. Bring out – develop

31. Bring around – persuade

32. Bring up – raise

33. Brush off – reject

34. Brush up – improve

35. Build up – accumulate 

36. Burst in – interrupt

37. Butt in – interrupt

 

UNN PUME Example

After the strike the traders .... the prices of their goods,

A. beat up. B. beat down. C. beat on. D. beat off

(B. beat down- strike with great force)

 

Example

You need to brush up on your Spanish (a) you need a brush from Spain (b) you need to study the history of Spain (c) you need to learn to play with a Spaniard (d) you need to improve your skills.

(you need to improve your skills).

List of Phrasal Verbs and their meaning (C) 

38. Call for – demand/collect

39. Call off – cancel

40. Call upon – invite

41. Carry off – win/succeed 

42. Carry on – continue

43. Carry out – execute

44. Carry over – continue

45. Carry through – complete

46. Cast out – expel

47. Cave in – collapse

48. Check in – arrive

49. Check out leave 

50. Check up – examine

51. Check up/on – investigate

52. Chew over – consider

53. Clear away – remove/disappear

54. Clear out – empty

55. Close in upon – encircle/develop

56. Close up – seal

57. Colour up – blush

58. Come along – accompany

59. Come at – attack

60. Come away – leave

61. Come back – return 

62. Come by – obtain 

63. Come down – descend

64. Come in – enter 

65. Come into – inherit

66. Come off – succeed/happen/disappear

67. Come on – progress 

68. Come out – emerge

69. Come up – occur

70. Cook up – invent

71. Count out – exclude 

72. Count up – arise

73. Cut across – interrupt

74. Cut down – fell/reduce

75. Cut off – disconnect/isolate

76. Cut up – slice

 

List of Phrasal Verbs and their meaning D – G

77. Die down – decrease

78. Do away with – abolish

79. Do over – decorate 

80. Do over – decorate 

81. Do up – renovate/improve

82. Doze off – fall asleep

83. Draw apart – separate

84. Draw in – attract

85. Drive at – mean 

86. Drive out – expel

87. End up – finish

88. Face up to – accept 

89. Fall back – retreat

90. Fall in – collapse

91. Fall out - quarrel 

92. Fall through – fail

93. Fall upon – attack

94. Figure out – calculate

95. Find out – discover

96. Finish off – kill

97. Fish for – seek

98. Fit out – equip

99. Fix on – select

100. Fix up – arrange

101. Follow on – continue

102. Follow through – pursue

103. Get along – manage

104. Get at – reach

105. Get away – leave/escape

106. Get back – return 

107. Get by – pass 

108. Get down to – tackle 

109. Get off – dismount

110. Get on – advance 

111. Get out – leave 

112. Get over – overcome

113. Get through – reach/pass

114. Get up – rise

115. Give away – distribute/betray

116. Give back – restore

117. Give in – surrender 

118. Give off – emit 

119. Give out – distribute

120. Go ahead – proceed

121. Go back on – retreat 

122. Go for – attack

123. Go into – investigate

124. Go off – explode

125. Go over – examine/reherse/review

126. Go through – endure/search

127. Go towards – contribute

128. Go with – accompany

129. Grow up – mature

 

List of Phrasal Verbs and their meaning (H – L)

130. Hand out – dispense/offer

131. Hand over – give/surrender

132. Hatch out – form

133. Have on – wear 

134. Head back – return 

135. Het up – very excited/upset

136. Hit on – discover 

137. Hold back – hesitate

138. Hold down – oppress

139. Hold on – wait 

140. Hold out – resist 

141. Hold up – delay

142. Inquire into – investigate

143. Iron out – remove

144. Join in – participate

145. Jump out – attack/reprove

146. Keep away – abstain 

147. Keep on – continue

148. Keep up – maintain/continue

149. Kick out – expel

150. Kick up – cause

151. Knock down – demolish 

152. Land up – end up/finish

153. Last out – survive

154. Laugh at – mock

155. Laid off – to cease to employ temporary/avoid

156. Lay aside – abandon 

157. Lay by – save 

158. Lay out - prepare 

159. Lead off – start

160. Leave out – omit 

161. Let down – disappoint

162. Let off – release/excuse

163. Let up – diminish 

164. Lie back – recline

165. Live up to – maintain

166. Look at – inspect/study

167. Look for – seek 

168. Look in – call/visit

169. Look into – investigate

170. Look on – regard/consider

171. Look up to – respect

172. Lose heart – quit/hopeless

 

PUME Example

We have been warned to mind how we talk to her because she is easily

A. heated up. B. set up. C. hot up. D. het up

(D. Het up as applied in the sentence is an adjective which describes someone who is anxious, excited or slightly angry).

 

Example

Try not to lose heart, said the man.

A. Try not to be bold and weak. B. Try not to become sad and hopeless. C. Try not to be happy and feeble. D. Try not to be timid and hopeful.

(Try not to become sad and hopeless)

 

List of Phrasal Verbs and their meaning (M – P)

173. Make do – cause to happen/behave/act

174. Make it – to be succesful

175. Make off with – steal 

176. Make out – distinguish 

177. Make up – compose/compensate

178. Map out – plan 

179. Mark out – indicate

180. Meet with – encounter 

181. Melt away – disappear 

182. Melt down – dissolve/soften

183. Mess up – spoil 

184. Miss out – omit 

185. Mix up – muddle/confuse/involve

186. Mount up – increase

187. Move about – fidget

188. Move forward – advance 

189. Move up – promote

190. Open out – unfold

191. Own up – confess/admit

192. Pass away – die

193. Pass out – faint/graduate

194. Pass over – overlook

195. Pay off – settle

196. Pick out – choose

197. Pick up – gain/acquire

198. Pitch into – attack

199. Point out – show

200. Pop up – stop

201. Press for – demand 

202. Pull back – withdraw

203. Pull down – demolish

204. Pull out – depart

205. Pull up – stop

206. Push on – continue 

207. Put aside – save

208. Put away – tidy

209. Put down – suppress

210. Put forward – advance/offer

211. Put in – insert

212. Put off – postpone

213. Put on – don/pretend

214. Put out – extinguish

215. Put up – stay/raise/accommodate

216. Put up with – tolerate

 

Example

I wonder how he will … being absent from school for a long time

(a) make in (b) make up (c) make off (d) make out

(make up)

 

List of Phrasal Verbs and their meaning (R – S)

217. Reflect on/upon - consider

218. Roll by – pass

219. Round on – turn against/assail

220. Round up – gather together/finalise session

221. Rule out – exclude

222. Run after – pursue

223. Run-away – flee

224. Run off with – steal

225. Run into – encounter

226. Run through – rehearse

227. Rush at – attack

228. Seal off – block

229. Search after/for – seek

230. See into – investigate 

231. See over – inspect

232. See to – repair

233. Send away – dispatch 

234. See away – banish 

235. Send back – return

236. Send for – order/summon 

237. Send out – dispatch/circulate

238. Set about – begin/start/attack

239. Set apart – differentiate 

240. Set back – hinder/delay

241. Set in – begin/start

242. Set off – start/enhance/begin

243. Set out – display

244. Set up – start/establish

245. Shake up – disturb

246. Show off – boast

247. Show up - appear

248. Shut away – isolate

249. Shut off – stop 

250. Shut down – end/close

251. Size up – judge

252. Sketch out – outline

253. Sleep on - to delay making a decision about it until the next day

254. Sleep over - to stay the night at somebody else home

255. Sort out – separate

256. Spark off – cause

257. Speak for – represent 

258. Spill over – overflow

259. Split up – separate/divide

260. Spread out – disperse/scatter

261. Spring up – begin

262. Spur on – encourage

263. Square up to – face

264. Square up – settle

265. Stack up – acquire

266. Stamp out – eradicate

267. Stand for – represent/tolerate

268. Stand out – be obvious/outstanding

269. Stand over – wait/supervise

270. Stand up for – defend

271. Stand up to – resist

272. Start off – begin

273. Start up – begin/open

274. Step in – intervene

275. Stick out – project

276. Stir up – agitate/disturb/cause/provoke

277. Stretch out – extend

278. Strike up – cause/provoke

279. Suck up – absorb

280. Sum up – summarize

281. Summon up – gather

 

PUME Exam

Now that the examination is fast approaching, the teachers have been instructed to _____their lessons.

A. round over. B. round up. C. round off. D. round in

(C. round off)

 

List of Phrasal Verbs and their meaning (T)

282. Tail off – lesson

283. Take aback – surprise

284. Take after – resemble

285. Take apart – dismantle

286. Take away – remove

287. Take down – dismantle

288. Take down – humiliate

289. Take off – remove

290. Take on – accept/assume/employ

291. Take out – extract 

292. Take up – shorten/occupy

293. Talk down to – patronise

294. Talk round – persuade

295. Talk over – discuss

296. Team up – co-operate

297. Thin out – disperse

298. Think about – consider

299. Think of – remember/imagine

300. Think up – invent

301. Throw about – waste

302. Throw down – surrender

303. Throw off - escape

304. Throw out – eject/expel/offer

305. Throw over – desert

306. Throw up – vomit

307. Tick off – rebuke

308. Tie in – blend

309. Tie together – match

310. Tie up – agree/bind/tether

311. Tire out – exhaust

312. Tot up – add up

313. Touch down – land

314. Touch off – ignite/cause

315. Train up – educate

316. Tuck in – feast

317. Turn away – reject 

318. Turn down – refuse/reject

319. Turn inside out – reverse

320. Turn off – stop

321. Turn on – switch on/start/attack

322. Turn out – empty/end/expel/produce

323. Turn over – upset/invent

324. Turn up – appear

325. Turn up – find

326. Turn sour – spoil

 

PUME Example

Emeka _____his father.

A. took after. B. took on. C. took to. D. took up

(A. took after - resemble).

 

Example

The friendship between Segun and Shehu has turned sour. This means that Segun and Shehu are

A. no longer friends. B. stilt friends. C. better friends now. D. getting to understand each other.

(no longer friends)

 

Example

We might wait a little longer, but he would not it .... soon (a) turn out (b) turn up (c) turn in (d) turn over

(turn up)

 

List of Phrasal Verbs and their meaning (W)

327. Walk out on – abandon

328. Ward off – deflect

329. Warm up – heat/enliven

330. Warm off - threaten

331. Watch out – observe

332. Wear away – erode

333. Wear down – erode/weaken

334. Wear on – pass

335. Wear out – exhaust 

336. Weed out – remove

337. Win back – regain

338. Win over – convert

339. Wind up – finish/end

340. Wipe out – obliterate

341. Wither away – fade/die

342. Work in – include

343. Work out – succeed

344. Work out – solve

345. Work up – cause/stimulate/stir up

346. Work up to – reach

347. Wrap up – cover/seal/finalise

348. Wrapped up – absorbed

349. Wriggle out of – escape

350. Write in for – apply

351. Write off – cancel

UNN PUTME Examples

1. My sister has ____ several food packages for my birthday party.

A. laid on. B. layed up C. laid off. D. layed on

(Laid on, 2008/2009, no 9)

 

JAMB Examples

2. In the question below, choose the option nearest in meaning to the word or phrase in italics.

It was a good try but it didn't quite work out. 

A. Come to B. come off C. come from D. come for

(come off)

 

3. Many workers were ___ [A. laid down B. laid off C. laid out D. laid up] as a result of the textile closure.

(laid off)


4. Many workers are not happy because they live a hand-to-mouth life.
A. They work hard with their hands B. They are voracious and avaricious C. They are barely surviving
D. They have rejected the use of spoons.
(They are barely surviving)

 

5. It was a good try but it didn't quite work out. A. Come to B. come off C. come from D. come for

(come off)
